item.title: Is the free movement of people in the European Economic Area (EEA) distinct from that in the EU?
item.description:
Karin Fl√∏istad: PhD Candidate, European University Institute; practicing lawyer at Norwegian law firm Simonsen Vogt Wiig The UK’s post-Brexit relationship with the EU often involves discussions about the free movement of people, with the EEA Agreement frequently cited as a potential model. This piece will analyze two key distinctions between the EEA Agreement’s approach to the free movement of people and that of full EU membership. The EEA Agreement integrates the EU’s single market with three members of the European Free Trade Association (EFTA): Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/is-the-free-movement-of-people-in-the-european-economic-area-eea-distinct-from-that-in-the-eu/
